instruction:
A job description is a document that clearly states the requirements, duties, responsibilities, and skills required to perform a specific role. You need to write a job description based on the given information. You should describe responsibilities and duties in your job description in a logical order. Remember that potential employees often get their first impression of your company from your job description. So, the job description should convey the attractiveness of your company.

Company: [Company name]
Job: Software Engineer
Job Responsibilities:
Receive and perform code reviews with other engineers.
Write unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to verify functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
Work collaboratively with fellow software engineers to build features requested by business stakeholders.
Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
Diagnose, debug, and perform root cause analysis of issues and defects.
Skills and experience that will lead to success:
Experience with a modern software programming language. We use Python, and Pyspark extensively.
Experience with cloud systems like AWS or Azure
Experience writing SQL queries 
Strong written and verbal communication skills
Eagerness to work in a highly-collaborative environment
Some visualization experience such as Tableau or PowerBI is helpful
output:
*Job Title:* Software Engineer

*Company Overview:*

[Company name] is a leading technology company known for our innovative big data solutions. We are looking for a skilled Software Engineer to join our dynamic team of professionals. Our company offers a fast-paced, collaborative environment that encourages continuous learning and growth.

*Job Responsibilities:*

1. Collaborate with other engineers to perform code reviews.
2. Write and maintain unit, integration, and end-to-end tests to ensure functionality using automated testing frameworks such as Pytest.
3. Work closely with the cross-functional team to build features according to business stakeholders' requests.
4. Participate in Agile teams to develop, test, and debug complex data processing pipelines and data analysis applications using big data processing systems such as Apache Spark.
5. Identify, troubleshoot, and resolve issues and defects collaboratively with other engineers.

*Skills and Experience Requirements:*

1. Experience in modern software programming languages (preferably Python and PySpark).
2. Experience implementing cloud solutions using AWS or Azure.
3. Proficiency in writing SQL queries.
4. Excellent written and verbal communication skills.
5. Ability to work well in a collaborative environment.
6. Prior experience with visualization tools such as Tableau or PowerBI is a plus.

*Why Choose Us:*

At [Company name], we recognize the potential in our employees and provide them with the necessary resources to flourish. You will have the chance to work with a team of experts who are passionate about their work while receiving competitive compensation and benefits. We pride ourselves on a culture of inclusivity, collaboration, and innovation. Our employees have access to extensive training and development programs, enabling them to enhance their skills and continuously grow in their roles.

If you are passionate about big data and excited to work in a collaborative environment, this is an excellent opportunity to join our team; we encourage you to apply.

Dear [Applicant Name],

I hope this message finds you in good health and high spirits. I am writing to communicate with you about your job application for the position of [position name] at [company name]. I'd like to express my sincere gratitude for your interest and taking the time to apply for this role. I have now reviewed your application, and I truly appreciate your qualifications, skills, and experience.

After evaluating all the candidates, I'm sorry to say that we have decided to offer the position to another candidate who had an overall better fit for our requirements. You came in second in our selection process, and I want you to know that we were truly impressed with your excellent job application, recommendations, and interview performance. However, in this competitive hiring process, it's not uncommon for more than one highly qualified candidate to apply for the same job.

Please note that this decision in no way reflects your talents and capabilities. We acknowledge that you possess the necessary skills and qualifications that would have made you an asset to our team. Unfortunately, we can only hire one person, and we believe that the other candidate's experience and strengths better align with our immediate needs.

We value your interest in our company and would like to keep you in mind for any future positions that may become available in our organization. Thank you again for considering our company as a future career option, and we wish you the best of success in your job search.

If you have any questions, please feel free to contact us. I hope you will have the opportunity to join our organization later as we continue to grow and create new jobs.

instruction:
Write a section for a blog post and try to cover all of the provided information about this section in your text.

Blog Topic: 7 Fall Fashion Trends Worth Taking on Your Trip
Section Title: Trusty Jeans
Main point of the section: jeans can be worn all year and look good with everything .
output:
> **Trusty Jeans: Your Go-To Denim for Fall Travels**

As the weather starts to cool down and the leaves change colors, so do our wardrobes. One item that remains a staple throughout all seasons is denim, particularly trusty jeans. Not only do they offer versatility and comfort, but jeans can also elevate any outfit, making them a travel essential. In this section, we'll explore the benefits of wearing jeans on your fall trips and provide some styling tips to get you ready for your next adventure.

_Why Jeans Are Perfect for Fall Travels_

1. **Versatility:** Jeans can be dressed up or down, making them the ultimate wardrobe staple. Whether you're exploring bustling cities or retreating to nature reserves, jeans can easily transition from sightseeing to hiking in comfort.
2. **Comfort:** Fall temperatures can be unpredictable, and you'll want a fabrics that can keep up with both warmth and cool weather fluctuations whilst still looking stylish. Jeans made from stretch or breathable fabrics can keep you comfortable and looking stylish.
3. **Longevity:** Denim is a classic and timeless material that can easily last you a good few seasons, making it a cost-effective investment for your wardrobe.
4. **Style:** Jeans have been a trendy choice for decades and are a great choice for anyone looking for an easy, effortless look. They can easily be dressed up with ankle boots, or kept casual with sneakers for a comfortable look.

_How to Wear Jeans for Fall Travels_

1. **Styles:** Opt for a classic straight leg fit or try a bootcut style to balance the weight of boots with the cut of your jeans. Skinny jeans can create a streamlined and fashion-forward appearance, while a flare leg can break up a straight silhouette.
2. **Colours:** For fall, stick to classic shades like black, grey, and dark blue for a sultry, sophisticated look or consider adding a touch of color with rust, dusty pink, and olive green.
3. **Accessories:** Express your individual style by utilizing accessories like leather belts, beaded necklaces and ankle boots, or a cozy scarf wrap. Mix-and-matching with other pieces can result in a chic and stylish outfit for an autumnal stroll.
4. **Layers:** The key to dressing for fall weather is to layer up. Pair your jeans with an oversized sweater and a leather jacket for extra warmth. For a more laid-back vibe, combine your jeans with a button-up shirt and a denim jacket.

In conclusion, jeans are an essential component of your travel wardrobe. Stylish, comfortable, and timeless, this versatile staple is a great investment for both fashion and practicality. Whether you prefer classic cuts or newer, trendy styles, jeans can elevate any ensemble, making them a must-have for any traveller's wardrobe.

instruction:
Using the provided topic as a starting point, brainstorm ideas for videos that can be made about it on YouTube.

In spite of the fact that procrastination feels bad to you, why do you do it?
output:
Brainstormed ideas for videos on YouTube about the topic "In spite of the fact that procrastination feels bad to you, why do you do it?":

1. "The Science of Procrastination": The video can explore the psychological and neurological reasons behind why we procrastinate, despite feeling the negative effects of it. Neuroscientific research can be cited to show that the brain's reward center is activated by waiting until the last minute, even if it comes with negative consequences.
2. "Breaking the Procrastination Cycle": This video can offer practical and actionable tips and strategies to help viewers overcome procrastination. Techniques like creating a schedule or using the Pomodoro technique can be explained, as well as tips for managing anxiety and self-doubt, which are often underlying reasons behind procrastination.
3. "The Benefits of Starting Small": Sometimes we procrastinate because we feel overwhelmed by the task at hand. This video can highlight how breaking down a task into smaller, manageable steps can be motivating and ultimately help achieve success. The video could also explore the concept of building momentum by completing simple tasks to gain confidence for more challenging ones.
4. "The Psychology of Deadlines": This video can explore the psychological relationship between deadlines and procrastination. It can show how setting artificial deadlines or utilizing versions of the "two-minute rule" can help motivate individuals to take action and avoid procrastination.
5. "The Importance of Self-Reflection": Often, procrastination is a symptom of deeper issues like low motivation or a lack of purpose. This video could encourage viewers to reflect on their values, passions, and long-term goals before attempting to tackle a task. It could also offer steps for identifying and addressing any underlying issues that might be contributing to procrastination.
6. "The Impact of Procrastination on Our Lives": Procrastination can have significant negative effects on our lives, including decreased productivity, missed opportunities, and increased stress and anxiety. This video could focus on exploring these impacts and the consequences of allowing procrastination to continue unchecked.
7. "Case Studies of Successful Procrastinators": While procrastination is often viewed negatively, there are some individuals who are able to harness their procrastination tendencies to achieve success. This video could highlight stories of successful procrastinators and show how they have used procrastination to their advantage in a constructive way.
8. "Overcoming Procrastination Through Mindfulness": This video could explore how practicing mindfulness and staying present can help individuals overcome procrastination. Hypnosis and meditation techniques can be explained and demonstrated to help viewers calm their minds and stay focused and motivated.
9. "How to Manage Distractions and Stay on Task": While sometimes procrastination is a product of external factors, like distractions or competing priorities, it can also be a reflection of internal issues. This video could offer strategies for managing distractions and staying on task, like creating a dedicated workspace or utilizing apps to limit access to certain websites or notifications.
10. "Overcoming Procrastination in the Digital Age": The rise of technology and social media has made procrastination easier than ever. This video could offer tips on how to manage digital distractions and incorporate technology into a productive workflow, like using productivity apps or setting dedicated times for social media breaks.

instruction:
Find the answer that best describes the underlined SAT word. Select the correct option and explain the meaning of the underlined word.

Despite the _cacophony, the student tried to study. 
A. Loud sounds
B. Difficult subject
C. Late hour
D. Low lighting
output:
The underlined word in the sentence "Despite the cacophony, the student tried to study" is "cacophony."

Cacophony is defined as a harsh, discordant, or unpleasant combination of sounds. It is often used to describe a noisy, confusing or chaotic sound.

In this context, the sentence suggests that there were loud, unpleasant sounds (cacophony) surrounding the student, making it difficult to concentrate and study. Despite this noise, the student still tried to focus and study.

Therefore, the correct answer is A: Loud sounds.

instruction:
Find synonyms for the given word. You need to write down how the provided synonyms differ from the original word in terms of meaning, usage, etc.

adversity
output:
1. Calamity - Similar to adversity, calamity refers to a misfortune or disaster that befalls someone. However, calamity is often used to refer to a sudden and catastrophic event, whereas adversity can refer to a long-lasting or chronic challenge.
2. Difficulty - While adversity focuses on overcoming challenges or obstacles, difficulty is more specific to a task or situation that presents a challenge. Difficulty may refer to a specific obstacle that needs to be overcome, whereas adversity may encompass a broader range of challenges or setbacks.
3. Affliction - Affliction generally refers to a severe or profound suffering, such as from illness or injury. Adversity, on the other hand, can encompass a wider range of difficulties, including financial, emotional, or personal struggles.
4. Hardship - Hardship shares similarities with adversity, in that both relate to facing difficult situations. However, hardship often connotes a more severe or extreme circumstance, while adversity may refer to a more general or ongoing challenge.
5. Tragedy - Tragedy typically implies a more life-altering or catastrophic event compared to adversity, which encompasses a broader range of challenges. Tragedy often carries a sense of finality or inevitability, whereas one may overcome adversity through resilience and determination.

instruction:
Discuss the origins and history of the word that has been given to you.

oblique
output:
The word "oblique" has ancient roots, coming from the Latin word "obliquus," which means "slanted" or "not vertical." The term originally referred to a line or angle that is not straight but angled or bent, and from there evolved to describe any action, object, or idea that is indirect or not straightforward.

Throughout history, "oblique" has been used in various contexts and disciplines. In mathematics, it denotes an angle that is not a right angle, while in astronomy it refers to the apparent movement of celestial bodies across the sky. In language, it can describe a type of sentence in which the grammatical subject is not the same as the grammatical object.

In military strategy, an attack that is "oblique" involves approaching the enemy from an angle or direction other than straight on, with the aim of surprising and outmaneuvering them. This tactic has been employed by many successful generals throughout history, including Alexander the Great, who famously used oblique maneuvers in his conquests.

Today, "oblique" continues to be used in various fields, from marketing and advertising to art and design. It is still considered a versatile and useful term that conveys a sense of indirectness, non-conformity, or unexpectedness.

instruction: Write a step-by-step guide for resolving GitHub merge conflicts.
output:
Here is a detailed and comprehensive step-by-step guide for resolving merge conflicts in GitHub. Follow these steps to easily resolve merge conflicts and continue with your work seamlessly.

1. Understand the Conflict

When you get notification of a merge conflict, it means that there is a difference between the local and remote versions of the file you’re trying to merge. Take some time to carefully read the messages from your local and remote repositories to determine the nature of the conflict. This will help you identify which changes need to be kept or whether one or both should be discarded.

2. Choose a Merge Strategy

GitHub supports two main strategies for handling merge conflicts:

* Our Merge (default): This strategy combines the changes made in both repositories without regard for the origin of each change. It's best suited for minor changes made in different lines of code.

* Recursive: This strategy is better suited for larger code changes. GitHub will display several options for how to merge the changes, and in this option, you will be asked to select the appropriate version to keep.

3. Use the Merge Editor

GitHub provides a merge editor, which allows you to see the changes in both repositories and resolve conflicts in the order in which they occurred. This editor will highlight the conflicting lines in yellow.

* Resolve Conflicts Manually: Use the conflict editor to review and resolve the conflicts. Conflicting changes can be rapidly identified, and GitHub allows you to keep, remove, or modify selected portions of the conflicting code.

* Use Patches: When manually resolving conflicts is too complex, GitHub allows you to add and remove entire sections of a file. To use this feature, select the option to use patches in your merge tool, then copy the patches from the merge conflict message.

4. Save the Resolved Conflicts

When you're satisfied with the changes you've made in the merge editor, click the Save button. This will update the file in your local repository to reflect the merged changes.

5. Commit and Push the Changes

After saving the resolved conflicts, you'll need to commit and push the changes to your remote repository. Run the following commands:

* git add <file-name>
* git commit -m "Resolved merge conflict"
* git push origin <branch-name>

This will update your branch with the resolved conflicts and push it to your remote repository.

In conclusion, resolving merge conflicts in GitHub can be a daunting task, but with the above steps, it is a manageable task. You can now confidently identify the conflicts, choose the appropriate merge strategy, solve the conflicts manually or with patches, commit and push the changes to your repository.

instruction:
One or more jobs can be run automatically by a workflow. The workflows are defined in the repository as YAML files and will run if an event occurs in the repository, as well as manually, or on a certain schedule.
Bring an example of a workflow that demonstrate the CI/CD features of GitHub Actions.
output:
Sure! Here's an example of a workflow that demonstrates CI/CD features using GitHub Actions:
```yaml
name: CI/CD Workflow
on:
  push:
    branches:
      - main
  pull_request:
    branches:
      - main

jobs:
  build:
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v2
      with:
        path: dist

    - name: Set up Node.js
      uses: actions/setup-node@v2
      with:
        node-version: "16.x"
    - name: Install dependencies
      run: |
        npm ci

    - name: Build package
      run: npm run build
      env:
        NODE_ENV: production
    - name: Test packages
      run: npm test

  deploy:
    needs: build
    runs-on: ubuntu-latest
    needs: build
    steps:
    - name: Checkout repository
      uses: actions/checkout@v2
      with:
        path: dist

    - name: Set up AWS Credentials
      id: aws_credentials_setup
      uses: actions/configure-aws-credentials@v1
      with:
        aws-access-key-id: ${{ secrets.AWS_ACCESS_KEY_ID }}
        aws-secret-access-key: ${{ secrets.AWS_SECRET_ACCESS_KEY }}
        region: ${{ secrets.AWS_REGION }}

    - name: Deploy package
      id: deployment
      run: |
        aws s3 cp --acl public-read dist/my-project.zip s3://my-bucket/my-project.zip
        aws s3 cp index.html dist/ /

cache:
  paths:
    - .npm/**/*
    - /*.js
    - /*.json
    - /*.css
    - /*.png
    - /*.svg
    - /*.eot
    - /*.woff
    - /*.ttf
    - /*.gif
    - /*.jpg
    - /*.mp4

workflows:
  build-and-deploy:
    jobs: [build, deploy]
```
In this example, we have two jobs:

1. `build` job runs on an Ubuntu instance, checks out the repository, sets up Node.js, installs dependencies, builds, and tests packages.
2. `deploy` job runs after the `build` job is successfully completed, checks out the repository, set up AWS credentials, deploys the package to an S3 bucket, and deploys the website to the S3 bucket.

The `cache` section defines the paths of the files to cache between the `build` and `deploy` jobs. This will speed up the `deploy` job as it will not re-download the files.

The `workflows` section defines a `build-and-deploy` workflow that contains the `build` and `deploy` jobs. This workflow will trigger automatically when pushing or creating a pull request to the `main` branch.

This example demonstrates how GitHub Actions can be used to implement a continuous integration and deployment (CI/CD) pipeline for a Node.js project.

instruction:

Tagline: "Put on a happy face."

The Joker (2019) revolves around the origins of one of the most iconic and complex villains in the Batman universe – the Joker. The phrase symbolizes the pressures society puts on individuals to conform to societal expectations and hide their true emotions, which is reflected in the Joker's initial state. As the story unfolds, the audience witnesses the evolution of the character and his descent into chaos, highlighting the destructive consequences of suppressing one's true self.

The tagline is effective in piquing the interest of the audience, not only because it hints at the plot's central theme but also because it is memorable and iconic. The use of the plural "faces" also adds an extra layer of intrigue, as it invites the viewers to imagine the different facets of the Joker's complex personality.

In summary, the tagline for Joker (2019) is a perfect encapsulation of the film's essence. It intrigues the audience, hints at the plot, and encapsulates the themes of the movie.

instruction:
Give a brief summary of the movie or series' plot.

Breaking Bad (TV Series 2008–2013)
output:
Breaking Bad is a critically acclaimed television drama that follows the journey of Walter White (played by Bryan Cranston), a high school chemistry teacher who, upon learning that he has terminal cancer, decides to begin producing and selling methamphetamine (meth) to secure his family's financial future.

Walter teams up with his former student, Jesse Pinkman (played by Aaron Paul), and together they establish themselves as major players in the local drug trade. As their operation expands, Walter's character transforms from a mild-mannered teacher to a ruthless drug lord, facing increasingly violent situations and moral dilemmas.

Throughout the series, viewers witness a complex web of relationships, betrayals, and alliances among drug lords, law enforcement, and everyday citizens. The series explores themes of morality, power, and the fragility of human relationships as Walter's empire grows and he spirals deeper into the criminal underworld.

Breaking Bad is widely regarded as one of the greatest television dramas of all time and has won numerous awards, including multiple Primetime Emmy Awards for Outstanding Drama Series, Outstanding Directing, and Outstanding Lead Actor.

instruction:
Decide whether children can watch the given movie. Mention what makes it inappropriate if you think they can't.

The Dark Knight (2008)
output:
From a content rating perspective, "The Dark Knight" (2008) has been rated PG-13 for intense crimes, violence, and some disturbing images. This means that parents are advised to exercise caution and consider their children's maturity levels before allowing them to watch the movie.

This movie contains several factors that may make it inappropriate for young children, including:

1. Mature themes: The Dark Knight deals with adult themes such as crime, corruption, and morality. It can be quite confusing for children to understand complex and mature subjects, which may lead to confusion or distress.
2. Violence: The movie has a significant amount of violence, including death, gunfights, and brutal fights. These scenes can be disturbing or frightening for young children, potentially causing nightmares or anxiety.
3. Language: The film contains several instances of strong language, which may not be appropriate for young children. Using inappropriate or offensive words can lead to shame or confusion.
4. Scary scenes: Though "The Dark Knight" is not typically classified as a horror movie, it has some scenes that may be considered frightening or intense, such as the Joker's (Heath Ledger) disturbing makeup and actions, which could be unsettling to young children.

In conclusion, while "The Dark Knight" may be a great movie for older teens or mature adults, it may not be suitable for young children due to its mature themes, violence, language, and frightening scenes. It is essential to evaluate the maturity level of your children and select movies that are appropriate for their age and maturity.

instruction:
Write a short analysis of the cinematography in the movie.

Dead Poets Society
output:
"Dead Poets Society" (1989) directed by Peter Weir, is a well-crafted film that elegantly blends striking cinematography with powerful storytelling. The cinematography, under the direction of John Seale, is a significant component of the movie's overall success.

Throughout the film, Seale uses various techniques, including shallow focus, wide shots, and slow-motion sequences, to enhance the emotional impact of each scene. For instance, the opening scene with the students walking towards the camera emphasizes their unity and the sense of community present at Welton Academy, while the use of shallow focus during the poetry readings highlights the importance of words and emotions.

The use of contrasting light and dark tones creates a stark visual illustration of the differences between tradition and rebellion, educational rigidity versus individuality. John Keating’s (Robin Williams) lectures and flashback sequences are often accompanied by soft and warm lighting, giving the audience a sense of hope and authenticity, while the cold and dimly lit confinement of the academic building creates a sense of stifling monotony.

Moreover, the use of wide shots and captivating landscapes establishes the protagonist’s innermost thoughts, desires, and aspirations. Breathtaking scenes, like the boys sitting on the hilltop, looking at the night sky, and the final procession, create a sense of unity and provide emotional culmination to the narrative.

In conclusion, "Dead Poets Society" stands out for its enchanting cinematography that effortlessly matches the film's themes and enhances its emotional impact. By utilizing various camera techniques, lighting, and landscapes, John Seale creates a memorable visual narrative that will stay with the viewer long after watching the movie.

instruction:
Please let me know your thoughts on the given place and why you think it deserves to be visited.

Barcelona, Spain
output:
Barcelona, Spain is a truly remarkable city that deserves to be visited for numerous reasons. With its rich cultural history, beautiful architecture, unique cuisine, and breathtaking coastal views, Barcelona is one of the most popular tourist destinations in the world. Here are a few reasons why Barcelona is an excellent place to visit:

1. Architecture: Barcelona boasts an impressive collection of modernist architecture, led by the groundbreaking work of Antoni Gaudi. The city's most famous buildings include the Sagrada Familia, Park Guell and Casa Batllo. These structures feature intricate designs, colorful mosaics, and stunning sculptures that reflect the unique artistic style of Gaudi and the Barcelona Modernisme movement.

2. History and Culture: As the birthplace of Antoni Gaudi and other world-renowned artists, Barcelona has a rich cultural history that attracts travelers from all over the world. Visitors can explore the Gothic Quarter, a medieval neighborhood dating back to the 14th century, and the Picasso Museum, which houses an extensive collection of artwork by the famous Spanish artist, to gain a deeper appreciation for Barcelona's history and culture.

3. Food and Wine: Spanish cuisine is known for its bold flavors and vibrant colors, and Barcelona offers some of the best dining experiences in Europe. From traditional Catalan dishes like paella and escalivada to fresh seafood caught along the city's coastline, visitors can enjoy a wide variety of delicious meals while in Barcelona.

4. Beaches and Outdoor Activities: Barcelona is located on the Mediterranean Sea and boasts over four miles of beautiful beaches, making it an ideal destination for sun-loving tourists. Visitors can relax on the sandy shores and swim in the crystal-clear waters, or participate in outdoor activities like kayaking and cycling.

5. Festivals and Events: Barcelona hosts a variety of festivals and events throughout the year, including the famous La Mercè celebration in late September, which features fireworks, concerts, and other activities. Visitors can experience the unique culture and vibrant energy of Barcelona through these events.

Overall, Barcelona is a stunning city with a wealth of attractions and a vibrant culture that's sure to leave a lasting impression on anyone who visits. Whether you're interested in architecture, history, food, or simply enjoying the beauty of the Mediterranean Sea, there's something for everyone in Barcelona.

instruction:
Consider the best time of year to visit the given city, and provide your reasons for choosing that time.

Sydney, Australia
output:
I don't have personal preferences, but i can provide suggestions based on research and climatic data. sydney, australia is an attractive city that offers a plethora of activities for travelers. the best time to visit sydney would be from september to november (autumn) or march to may (spring) explicitly for mild temperatures and pleasant climate. moreover, these seasons would provide visitors with fewer crowds, better deals, and fewer chances of encountering extreme weather.

during the autumn season, temperatures vary from 8°c to 21°c, making it a perfect time for outdoor activities such as sightseeing, hiking, or visiting cultural events. additionally, autumn offers an overall serene experience with slightly fewer tourists than summer, so you can enjoy attractions like the opera house, bondi beach, or the royal botanic garden without a hustle.

spring also provides good weather conditions with mild temperatures between 11°c to 23°c, ideal for exploring the city or spending time on the beaches. it's also the perfect time to attend festivals and events like the sydney tennis tournament, vivid sydney, and the sydney royal easter show. spring is another low season for tourism, so you can enjoy lower rates for accommodations, flights, and tours.

however, if you prefer slightly warmer temperatures, from december to february (summer) is an excellent time to visit sydney. during this time, temperatures can soar up to 26°c, making it ideal for beach activities, outdoor recreation, and sunbathing. the summer months offer more crowding, higher prices, but it's a great time to experience the city's vibrant cultural events, such as the sydney new year's eve fireworks display, which attracts around 1 million people each year.

in summary, the best time to visit sydney would be from september to november (autumn) or march to may (spring), owing to milder temperatures, pleasant climate, fewer tourists, and good deals. this period offers the most comfortable weather while allowing you to enjoy various activities and events without large crowds or hefty budget constraints.

instruction: Make a questionnaire to help hotel guests write hotel reviews.
output:
Dear Hotel Guest,

instruction:
Make a list of the top places in the U.S. to visit at the given time.

November
output:
November is a great time of year to visit several destinations throughout the United States. Here are some of the top places to consider:

1. Moab, Utah - The cooler temperatures in November make this a fantastic time for outdoor activities like hiking, mountain biking, or scenic drives through Arches National Park or Canyonlands National Park.
2. Miami, Florida - With comfortable temperatures in the 70s and 80s and less humidity than during the summer months, November is a great time to enjoy Miami's beaches, art deco architecture, and vibrant nightlife.
3. New England - The autumn foliage display peaks in late October, but visiting New England during November allows for fewer crowds and lower hotel rates. Explore historically significant towns like Boston or enjoy the scenery by driving along the coast.
4. Scottsdale, Arizona - The weather in Scottsdale is perfect during November, with average temperatures in the mid-70s. Enjoy the cities' art galleries, world-class spas, and outdoor activities like horseback riding or hot air balloon rides.
5. San Diego, California - The sunny climate in San Diego makes it a great year-round destination, but November offers lower crowds and fewer tourists, and average temperatures in the 70s. Explore Balboa Park, go whale watching, or relax on the beach.
6. New Orleans, Louisiana - November is a great time to visit the Big Easy, with several festivals taking place during the month, such as the New Orleans Film Festival or the Oak Street Po-Boy Festival. Explore the French Quarter, listen to live music, and savor the delicious cuisine.
7. Asheville, North Carolina - If you're interested in fall foliage and cool mountain air, Asheville is the perfect destination during November. Explore the vibrant downtown, visit the Biltmore Estate, and plan hiking adventures in the nearby Blue Ridge Mountains.
8. Sedona, Arizona - Surrounded by red rocks, Sedona offers a unique and beautiful landscape. Enjoy hiking, meditating, or simply taking in the views of some stunning natural wonders.
9. Austin, Texas - Austin is known for its vibrant music scene and lively cultural events. In November, you can enjoy the Austin Film Festival, the ATX Television Festival, or the fun and unique Eeyore's Birthday Party.
10. Chicago, Illinois - November presents a fantastic opportunity to experience the beauty of Chicago before the bitter cold winter sets in. Take a walk along the Chicago River, admire the architecture, and enjoy Chicago-style deep dish pizza.

These are just a few of the many fantastic destinations to explore throughout the United States during November.

instruction: Name the top cities in France that should not be missed. Include the best aspects of each place as well.
output:
Certainly, France is a beautiful country with many incredible cities to visit. Below are some of the top cities that should not be missed:

1. Paris - As the capital city, Paris is undoubtedly a must-visit destination. It's famous for its iconic landmarks, such as the Eiffel Tower, the Louvre Museum, and Notre-Dame Cathedral. You can also enjoy strolling along the Seine River, sampling the finest French cuisine, and indulging in some shopping on the Champs-Élysées.
2. Nice - Located in the south of France, Nice is a beautiful city on the Mediterranean coast. It's renowned for its colorful, vibrant Old Town, picturesque Promenade des Anglais, and gorgeous Belle Époque architecture. Nice is also a great destination for foodies, with its delicious local cuisine and abundant fresh seafood.
3. Lyon - Known as the culinary capital of France, Lyon is a city that should be on the list of any food lover. It boasts over 1,500 restaurants and a variety of Michelin-starred dining options. Beyond the food scene, Lyon is also a city of culture, with a rich history and many impressive museums and art galleries to explore, such as the Musée des Beaux-Arts de Lyon.
4. Bordeaux - Bordeaux is a charming port city in southwestern France, famous for its wine production. Visitors can enjoy wine tastings and vineyard tours in the surrounding countryside, and then explore the historic city center with its elegant 18th-century architecture, museums, and plenty of trendy cafes and shops.
5. Strasbourg - Located in the northeastern region of Alsace, Strasbourg is a picturesque city with stunning medieval architecture and charming canals. It's also the location of the European Parliament and perfect for anyone interested in politics or international relations. Don't miss the opportunity to indulge in local specialties like choucroute (sauerkraut and sausage) and kugelhopf (a type of cake).

Each of these destinations has something unique and special to offer, and they are all worth experiencing on a visit to France.

Is there a way of reading one single character from the user input? For instance, they press one key at the terminal and it is returned (sort of like getch()). I know there's a function in Windows for it, but I'd like something that is cross-platform.
